recipe.name: Mini Strawberry French Toast
recipe.description: Super fast to make, and a great breakfast in bed because it's crumb and cutlery free!
recipeIngredient: 10 slices of baguette ((french stick), around 2 1/5" / 3cm thick)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the sugar and strawberries in a bowl and set aside to macerate (it sweats to form a bit of syrup).
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the sugar and strawberries in a bowl and set aside to macerate (it sweats to form a bit of syrup).

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly whisk the eggs, milk and salt in a shallow bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly whisk the eggs, milk and salt in a shallow bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large fry pan over medium high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt butter in a large fry pan over medium high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip each side of the bread slices into the egg, 3 seconds on each side. Place in the pan and fry each side for 2 1/2 minutes, until it is nicely browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip each side of the bread slices into the egg, 3 seconds on each side. Place in the pan and fry each side for 2 1/2 minutes, until it is nicely browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the fry pan, and serve, topped with the strawberries (use the syrup created), maple syrup and confectioners sugar (icing sugar), if using.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the fry pan, and serve, topped with the strawberries (use the syrup created), maple syrup and confectioners sugar (icing sugar), if using.

review.reviewBody: You definitely have got me craving french toast & breakfast in bed Nagi! This looks BEAUTIFUL.

Nagi, that first picture looks like it belongs in Williams-Sonoma! This french toasts sounds absolutely amazing. I won't see my boyfriend for Valentine's day, but I'm saving this recipe for his birthday in March!! Pinned!
